captions.text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today I am gonna be making something that
I got so many requests for after I made

my cheeseburger cake, and I’ve been watching
a lot of Bob’s Burgers lately, so
today I am gonna be making cheeseburger cupcakes!

The things you will need, will be: 1 Yellow
cake, or you can use your favorite

cake recipe, doesn’t have to be box cake,
lemon cake works really well, as long

as it looks like a cheeseburger bun color,
so something yellow.

1/2 a cup of vegetable oil, 1 cup of water,
green food coloring dye, some

toothpicks, 3 eggs, and coconut flakes. You’ll
also need a cupcake baking pan, and

I’ve lined it with these little paper liners,
1 big mixing bowl, and I’ve pre-made

some brownies, just use whatever is your favorite
brownie recipe.
Mmmmm!
Alright, let’s put it all together!
Hmmm-hmmm-hmmm!
1/2 a cup of this…
Then we’re gonna crack 3 eggs!
Bew!

Now you’re gonna mix for 3 minutes on a
medium speed.

Once your batter is all mixed, we’re gonna
fill these little cupcake trays.

And I like to put 3 scoops, to 2 scoops, depending
on how full they are, you just

want it 2/3 full, and now is a good
time to preheat your oven to 350.
Rewp! 1, 2, yeah we’re gonna do 3 scoops.

It’s OK to get messy, we’ve got cupcake
liners.
You’re just gonna fill all these trays.
Oh wow, this is really messy!

There’s probably a better way to do this,
some people put it in a little zip-lock

baggie and then… But… It doesn’t, it’s
OK, it’s OK to get messy.

Boom! Nailed it! Cupcakes look perfect, we’re
gonna throw these in the oven
for about 20 minutes on the heat of 350.

Now, while the cupcakes are baking we are
going to be making the lettuce out of
coconut flakes. Da-dew!

They’re just regular coconut flakes, we’re
gonna pour them into a small bowl

like this, and then we’re just gonna take
a little bit of green food coloring dye
and put a few drops in. Boop, boop!
Boop, boop, boop, boop, boop!

You can put as many as you want, however dark
green you want to make it.

But I’m just gonna take a little fork, mix
it all together.

Ta-da! Once you’ve dyed all your coconut
shavings green, we’re just gonna set

this aside, and what you’re gonna want to
do is get 2 plastic bags and fill them

with frosting, I put red frosting in this
bag, and yellow frosting in this bag.

And you can use a basic zip-lock, anything.
And this is going to be our
cheese and ketchup!

Once your cupcakes are done baking, take them
out of the oven and make sure they’ve

had plenty of time to cool before you do this.
Otherwise they will fall apart.

So what you’re gonna do is take a knife,
I’ve got a sharp knife, and you’re

gonna cut your cupcake in 1/2. So I’m gonna
turn it on its side so you can see.

And I’m gonna cut right below, I call it
the muffin top, the yummiest part of the

cupcake! Err-err-err-err! And you’re just
gonna cut all the way through.

So this will be the top of our hamburger bun,
and this will be the bottom.

I’m just gonna take the bottom 1/2 of the
cupcake, put it over here, and just

kind of eyeball how big the meat patty is
gonna be. I’m just taking a little

butter knife, and I’m just gonna cut around
so I know about how big I want
my meat patty to be.
That’s my kind of cheeseburger!
Oh my god I love brownies!

Now I shallassemble my cheeseburger. This
is technically my cheese, it may also

look like mustard, but this is a cheeseburger.
So, I’m gonna pretend this is cheese.
You’re just gonna put a little bit. Errrrroooop!
Go all the way around, zig-zag, perfect!

Now you’re gonna take your meat patty, mmmm!
Your brownie meat patty, and I’m just

squishing it, like so, so it looks really
meaty. Oh yeah!

Now you’re gonna take your ketchup, you’re
gonna put a little layer here, all
the way around, oh, doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!

And now you’re gonna take your coconut flakes,
our lettuce and sprinkle a

little bit. Oh coconut and chocolate, they
go so good together!

Now you’re gonna put on the top of your
hamburger.
Oh yum, look at that, meaty hamburger.

Alright, for the final touches, what we’re gonna
do is take these little toothpicks,

and put them all the way down, right in the
center to hold our little cupcake

together. Oh these are so cute! They’re
like bite-sized!

After I put these together, I thought, these
aren’t quite done!
I was thinking, what are they missing? Oh yeah the little sesame seeds, so I went through

all of my cupcake stuff and I found sprinkles!
So I went ahead and separated

some of the white sprinkles, doo-doo! Like
this, now we’re just gonna sprinkle
those on top of the little cheeseburgers.
I can haz cheeseburgers!

Ta-da! Here are our cheeseburger cupcakes,
they’re so cute and I love that they’re
bite size! With the brownie in the middle!

Thanks you guys for suggesting it, if you
have any other ideas for any other

Nerdy Nummies, please let me know, leave me
a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
OK, thanks you guys, bye-bye!
Oh my god I love brownies!

title: HOW TO MAKE CHEESEBURGER CUPCAKES - NERDY NUMMIES
